newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's BBAG brewer up on talk of S.Africa bid.
newsitem.headline: Austria's BBAG brewer up on talk of S.Africa bid.

text.p: Austrian brewery holding BBAG bucked the Vienna market's downtrend on Tuesday amid continuing rumours the group may sell its Brau Union unit to South African Breweries (SAB).
At 1108 GMT, the shares were steady at 743 schillings. The ATX index of 21 blue chips was down 2.39 percent at 1,186.25 at the same time, following Wall Street's drop on Monday.
"There are still rumours in the market that talks are taking place," a trader said. "If it came to a sale, the South Africans surely would have to pay a premium to the current market price."

Austrian daily Kronenzeitung reported on Saturday that SAB had bid five billion schillings for majority control of Brau Union. BBAG denied that it had any intention of selling Brau Union, which controls some two-thirds of Austria's beer market.
But traders said the market would take a positive stance on a possible sale of Brau Union to SAB, the world's fourth biggest beer maker.
"Absolutely positive," said another trader. "That certainly would be very good for the company."
